function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Incorporating uncertainty and variability in independent variables using a Monte Carlo approach may introduce errors in the modeling process.","Impact":"Inaccurate modeling may lead to incorrect estimations and predictions related to the spread of contagious diseases.","Mitigation":"Perform extensive validation and verification of the Monte Carlo approach, and utilize multiple modeling techniques to cross-validate the results.","Technologies":"Advanced data validation and modeling software, sensitivity analysis tools.","People":"Research scientists, epidemiologists, and data analysts.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health organizations."},{"Description":"Modeling SARS-CoV-2 RNA copies/L of wastewater as a point estimate with a uniform distribution may lead to underestimation or overestimation of viral load.","Impact":"Inaccurate estimation of viral load may affect public health decisions and interventions based on wastewater surveillance.","Mitigation":"Utilize additional data sources and modeling techniques to validate the estimates, and consider the range of uncertainty in viral load measurements.","Technologies":"Wastewater surveillance technology, advanced data modeling software.","People":"Public health experts, environmental engineers, and wastewater treatment specialists.","Owner":"Public health agencies, environmental protection agencies."},{"Description":"Modeling the shedding rate of SARS-CoV-2 RNA copies/g of feces as a log-uniform distribution may introduce variability that impacts the accuracy of infection prevalence estimates.","Impact":"Inaccurate prevalence estimates may lead to ineffective public health strategies and interventions to control the spread of COVID-19.","Mitigation":"Incorporate additional data on shedding rates from diverse sources, and validate the models using empirical studies and clinical data.","Technologies":"Biological sample analysis tools, statistical modeling software.","People":"Epidemiologists, public health researchers, and infectious disease specialists.","Owner":"Public health agencies, healthcare institutions."}]}
